meanings.definition: the quality of not being honest or genuine
meanings.sent1: Her insincerity was evident in her fake smile.
meanings.sent2: His insincerity made it hard to trust him.
meanings.sent3: The insincerity of the magician's tricks made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The insincerity of the politician's promises left a bitter taste.
meanings.sent5: The insincerity of the salesman was like a dark cloud over the deal.

meanings.definition: the act of pretending to feel or believe something
meanings.sent1: Their insincerity in pretending to like the gift was obvious.
meanings.sent2: I could see through her insincerity when she complimented my cooking.
meanings.sent3: The insincerity of the actors pretending to be aliens was comical.
meanings.sent4: His insincerity in pretending to be interested was like a mask.
meanings.sent5: The insincerity of his apology rang hollow in her ears.
